Name: Homework Helpers: Physics, Revised Edition (Homework Helpers (Career Press))

ReviewList.Text: One of the reasons I bought this physics study aid was because I read Mr. Curran's "Homework Helpers-Chemistry" and found it to be an excellent help in my pursuit to learn Chemistry.  The author once again has hit a homerun with his physics book. Concepts from the classical areas of physics (Newtonian mechanics, electricity, magnetism, light, thermodynamics)covered in a first-year course in high school or college are explained in a conversational style while retaining appropriate rigor.  The chapter tests are well-written (with the answers to test questions explained), and the interspersed diagrams help to reinforce topics covered in each chapter. I'm glad I came across both of these books.

The book arrived within a week and is helping me greatly prepare for the CSET science exam. Another excellent resourse is the Homework Helper-Chemistry. I recommend either of these books for anyone taking physics or chemistry at the high school, college level or someone like me preparing for a test. The Homework Helper assists me when I don't quite get the concept from the text book. Great resource. There are some questions that are given to help one understand and then the answers are just a few pages away.
Have used to help communicate messages and problems to kids in school.  Well outlined and has data needed.  Added with other sources, provides kids with solid understanding of physics applications.
This book has helped me to understand physics in easier terms, and it's also a great reference to review for exams.

Im absolutely horrible at physics. This book is the only reason why I actually made a C+ in my college course. It isnt the most indepth book for college physics, but it is excellent for understanding basic concepts for general physics. I used this book for understanding and used my textbook to work more difficult problems.

I bought this book a while ago for my college physics class and it helped greatly. Now I'm using it again for my radiologic physic classes, though it doesn't have everything needed for radiology, it explains a lot of other concepts needed thoroughly and has been a great help this semester.
This is a good review of the basics of physics.  I'm also reading the Chemistry, Biology, and Calculus versions of this series.  They all seem pretty good so far.

I'm also using to study from, and I find it very simple, step-by-step, and clear. Just watch out-the centripetal formulas (p.160) should show T^2 as the denominator, not T! But besides that little foible, highly recommended.

This book is SUPERB on the topics it does contain. It studies mechanics, electricity, magnetism, thermodynamics and heat, and nuclear/atomic physics. All of these topics are written well and explained clearly; like I said, it's very good on the topics it DOES contain. The only problem I've found with this book is that it doesn't include anything on Relativity or Quantum Mechanics. Yes, it does go in depth about light, photons, and the wave-particle duality of light. Very helpful overall in the basics, but it doesn't go into the really advanced topics. I can't tell if this was meant for College Physics or high-school physics........either way, the explanations were great and it is, really, a great book. If you're taking physics on any level, get this book.

This book did a really good job at introducing and explaining the concepts and helping me get a grasp of college intro physics. I used it first before reading the textbook allowing me to better understand the textbook. Without it I probably wouldn't have received an A in intro physics. However, it doesn't receive 5 stars from me because a couple of topics were missing (e.g. fluids, sounds and waves). I definitely recommend this book for any intro physics student in college or high school.

I personally liked this book, and will use in the future with my children. But when I bought it I did not realize it was high school physics and we are not there yet. I would not recommend this for someone until they learn the math first. I would not recommend using this book to teach the math, it would be better for extra practice, or to break down and develop a better understanding of physics.

This is a great additional to my Physic text book. I can look up formulas and get a idea of the subject like voltage and resistances straight to the point.  This help me enjoy reading the physic text book more.  The big help is I got the idea or direction of the subject.  It helps.

I teach physics and this is the book I use... No fluff, no pretty pictures, just good, easily understandable explanations of the basic foundations of physics.  I recommend this for anyone taking an intro to physics class!

Nice summaries of concepts. The problems are helpful and they are worked out well. To understand conceptually, my daughter uses this book plus Hewitt. Then works out the problems using her regular textbook.
This book is a very book for beginners or for reviewing if you forgot physics. It explains very good. I really recommend it.
Ordered to use for my Physics class and found it not to be helpful to my students.  They were not impressed with it and nor was I.

This is the perfect workbook to freshen up your physics skills. I bought this to prepare me for a test, and it did exactly that. This isn't for advanced physics, but for those who want to learn the basics. It helps lay the foundation for advancing further in the science.

So helpful for my 9th grade honors student.  She is taking her first physics class, which is actually at college level, and would not have gotten her "A" without the help of this book and the Quick Study Guide!
Mr. Curran is my high school physics teacher, he's a great funny teacher and this is a great helpful book for high school physics (standardized test curriculum.
Really good review and explanations -  A good  manual to use in conjunction with your physics text
This book is a support for a student who would like a better understanding of Physics.
Great
Level for High School  students or lower. From the write -up I was not expecting such a primary text. Oh well.
Book are in great shape... thanks you. I only check a few page and seem to be very understand able.
